title: Barnwell sorts through NFL playoff race chaos: Are the Colts, Chiefs and Ravens finished?
content: Daniel Jones' injury, the Ravens' red zone woes, the Bears' defensive mistakes and the Chiefs' drop issues meant big changes in the race for the postseason.

title: What do Week 14 games mean for the rest of the season?
content: Our reporters react to the action, answering lingering questions and detailing what you need to know.

title: Notre Dame AD: ACC caused 'permanent damage'
content: Notre Dame's AD ripped the ACC after its CFP snub, saying the conference that houses almost every Fighting Irish team has caused "permanent damage" to the relationship.

title: Sanders to remain Browns' QB1 for rest of season
content: Shedeur Sanders will continue as the Cleveland Browns' starting quarterback for the remainder of the season, coach Kevin Stefanski said Monday.

title: Arizona grabs top spot in Top 25 men's hoops poll
content: With a perfect start to the season, the Arizona Wildcats have taken the top sport in the AP Top 25 men's college basketball poll. Purdue, which sat atop the poll for three straight weeks, slid to sixth after losing to Iowa State.

title: Big Ten ties record with 9 teams in women's poll
content: The Big Ten matched The Associated Press Top 25 women's basketball record with nine ranked teams as Nebraska entered at No. 24 on Monday.

title: Tulane promotes assistant Hall to head coach
content: Tulane has promoted veteran assistant coach and former Southern Miss head coach Will Hall to head coach.

title: Salah out of Liverpool squad for UCL trip to Inter
content: Mohamed Salah has been omitted from Liverpool's squad for their Champions League clash with Inter Milan.

title: UFC's Chimaev to defend title then chase 2nd belt
content: UFC middleweight champ Khamzat Chimaev tells ESPN that he plans to defend his title one more time before moving up to light heavyweight to pursue a second title.

title: Canes' Cristobal feels for Irish: 'A tough business'
content: Miami coach Mario Cristobal is relieved the Hurricanes earned a berth in the College Football Playoff field, but he understands the selection process isn't perfect

title: Wetzel: Relax, the CFP selection process is (mostly) working
content: Don't overreact to this year's playoff rankings by blowing up the system. Chasing perfection is a fool's errand.

title: CFP Anger Index: An absurd farce over Notre Dame, Miami
content: Evaluating the committee's ranking process, and what teams should be most upset about in final CFP ranking.

title: How each of the 12 College Football Playoff teams could win the national title
content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

title: Saquon Barkley might have to save the Eagles' 2025 season. Here's why he hasn't been able to yet
content: A drastic turnaround for Barkley might feel far-fetched, but notable improvement in the run game is attainable.

title: MLB winter meetings updates, rumors and predictions: The latest buzz from Orlando
content: From predicting who will sign to the latest buzz from Florida, here's everything you need as baseball's hot stove season heats up.

title: Everything we know about the Heat's trade for Terry Rozier -- and whether he could be dealt again
content: Terry Rozier, who is scheduled to be arraigned Monday for his alleged role in a betting scheme, was traded to Miami in 2024 without any investigation being disclosed.

title: Will Daniel Jones start for the Colts in '26? Is the front office safe? Key questions for Indy
content: Will coach Shane Steichen and GM Chris Ballard survive a late-season freefall? What's next at QB in Indy?

title: Who has the most travel at 2026 World Cup? And why does it matter?
content: For many national teams, how they handle and recover from extensive travel could make or break their World Cup next summer.

title: Men: New No. 1 after Purdue's shock loss
content: The fifth in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what's next for every team in the ranking.

title: Free agents: Trevor Lawrence and Packers WRs among top options
content: All the free agent options worth adding as we look dive into Week 15 and the fantasy football playoffs.

title: Buzz: Etienne, Pollard and Godwin among players who were getting the ball on Sunday
content: Eric Moody's notebook highlights participation and usage trends that drove fantasy highs and lows on Sunday

title: The NHL's best this week: Terry Ryan and hockey dreams
content: From first-round draft pick to iconic character, Ryan's path is a unique one. Plus, this week's key NHL games.

title: What we know so far about Mo Salah's Liverpool future
content: One of the world's best players, Mohamed Salah looks set to leave Liverpool soon after venting his frustration at being benched. But what does the future hold for him?

title: In winning F1 title, Norris proves himself (and his doubters) wrong
content: Lando Norris doubted himself as a title contender earlier this year. Now, as the curtain falls on the F1 season, he can call himself a world champion.

title: How to watch Monsters Funday Football: Eagles vs. Chargers
content: "Monsters Inc." takes over "Monday Night Football" featuring the Charges vs. Eagles for "Monsters Funday Football." Here's how to catch the action.

title: Week 14 only added more chaos to the NFL playoff race -- "a bookmaker's dream"
content: Week 14 "set the tone" for many NFL teams as Super Bowl favorites faltered and underdogs picked up steam.

title: Pickups: Ryan Nembhard, Quentin Grimes among players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: UFC 323 fight grades: Why Dvalishvili-Yan wasn't the best fight on the card
content: Which fights were the best and worst of the last UFC PPV of 2025? Andreas Hale grades every fight from UFC 323.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Diomande as Salah replacement
content: Liverpool scouts have been watching 19-year-old RB Leipzig winger Yan Diomande and he could replace Mohammed Salah. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: UK Care Home Agency Owner Jailed For Illegally Hiring Indians
content: A director of a care home agency based in south-east England has been jailed for two-and-a-half years after being found guilty of repeatedly employing immigrants from India with no right to work in the UK.

title: Humayun Kabir's Mosque Fundraiser Floods Namesake MLA With 200 Calls
content: As one Humayun Kabir laid the foundation of a Babri Masjid-style mosque in Murshidabad, while another, 200 km away in Paschim Medinipore's Debra, fielded nearly 200 donation calls meant for his suspended namesake.

title: Chargesheet Filed Against AAP's Satyendar Jain In Sewage Plant Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a chargesheet against AAP leader Satyendar Jain and 13 others under the anti-money laundering law in connection with alleged corruption in awarding tenders for Delhi Jal Board sewage treatment plants.

title: IMF Lists UPI As World's Largest Real-Time Payment System
content: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has recognised India's Unified Payments Interface (UPI) as the world's largest retail fast-payment system by transaction volume, the Parliament was informed on Monday.

title: 'Ready To Work With India, Russia': China On Putin's Delhi Visit
content: China reacted positively to Putin's visit to India, framing the three countries as an important part of the Global South and saying that sound trilateral ties are conducive to regional and global peace and stability, besides their own interests

title: Jailed Actor Darshan Accused Of Harassing Inmate In Prison
content: Jailed superstar Darshan is facing charges of subjecting co-accused in the fan murder case to mental and physical torture in the Bengaluru Central Prison, where they are currently lodged along with him, sources stated on Monday.

title: 15 Tourists Escape As Bus Catches Fire During Safari Ride In Jaipur
content: A group of 15 tourists had a narrow escape when the bus they were travelling in caught fire during a safari at Nahargarh Biological Park here, officials said on Monday.

title: No Jobs In Assam, They Went To Goa To Find Work: Families Of Fire Victims
content: Families of the three men from Assam who died in the Goa nightclub fire on Monday said their children were forced to migrate to the western state due to the lack of livelihood opportunities in their area.

title: "Matter Of Immense Joy": PM Modi As UNESCO Cultural Heritage Session Begins
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his delight as the 20th session of UNESCO's Committee on Intangible Cultural Heritage commenced in India in the national capital on Monday, marking a significant cultural milestone for the country.

title: RBI Plans Long-Term USD/Rupee Swap Auction To Boost Liquidity
content: The Reserve Bank of India is set to inject liquidity into the banking system through a long-term USD/INR Buy/Sell Swap auction, marking a key move to ease financial conditions at a time when liquidity needs closer attention.

title: US National Security Report Names India As Key Partner: Foreign Ministry
content: The Ministry of External Affairs welcomed the newly released US National Security Strategy 2025 report, noting New Delhi's strategic importance to Washington and identifying India as a key partner in global security and strategic initiatives.

title: New NCERT Class 7 Book Says Pakistan Army-Backed Terror Attacks Hinder Ties
content: NCERT's new Class VII Social Science book has introduced a chapter on India's neighbours, noting that Pakistan Army-backed terror attacks have hindered India-Pak normal ties.

title: No Ambulance, Bihar Man Drags Stretcher With Mother's Body From Hospital To Home
content: Three men and a woman were seen pushing a stretcher with a body on it in the dead of night in Bihar's Nawada district.

title: India Pricing Was A "Glitch", Just Dummy Data, Says Starlink
content: After facing a configuration glitch that displayed Starlink's India pricing on its local website, the company said on Monday that the glitch has now been fixed and "those numbers do not reflect what the cost of Starlink service will be in India".

title: Baba Adhav, Pillar Of Maharashtra's Labour Movements, Dies At 95
content: Veteran social activist Dr Baba Adhav passed away in Pune on Monday night following a prolonged illness, his aide said.

title: After Suspension, Navjot Kaur Sidhu Calls Punjab Congress Chief "Corrupt"
content: Hours after Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Raja Warring announced her suspension from the party's primary membership, Navjot Kaur Sidhu on Monday termed him as "insensitive, irresponsible, morally dishonest and corrupt".

title: "Will Curtail IndiGo's Routes, Allocate Them To Others": Aviation Minister
content: Civil Aviation Minister K Ram Mohan Naidu on Monday said the government will curtail IndiGo's winter flight schedule and allocate them to other operators following the airline's recent large-scale operational disruptions.

title: After Goa Nightclub Fire, State Mandates Strict Crowd Control, Fire Safety
content: The Goa government on Monday issued an advisory following the devastating fire at a nightclub that killed 25 people.

title: China-Made Rocket Used In Thailand Airstrikes On Cambodia: Official
content: Thailand's airstrikes on Monday targeted Cambodian military facilities housing long-range artillery after surveillance signalled that rockets, including a Chinese-made variant, could be used to hit civilian areas, a Thai military official said.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Owners fled to Phuket within hrs of blaze; 'intent to evade probe'
content: North Goa nightclub owners, Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, fled to Phuket hours after a fire killed 25 people. Police confirmed their departure and issued a Look Out Circular, seeking Interpol's help.  Four staff members have been arrested as a magisterial inquiry into procedural lapses is underway.

title: Under fire from MAGA, Indian IT lobbying group aligns with Trump
content: A resurfaced video of an Indian-American immigration attorney's profanity-laced attack on Donald Trump at an IT lobbying conference has sparked a furious MAGA backlash. The incident intensified scrutiny of the H-1B visa system, leading entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy to withdraw from an upcoming ITServe conference.

title: Japan earthquake: Several reported injured, evacuation advised; what we know
content: A powerful 7.6 magnitude earthquake rocked northern Japan, triggering a tsunami of up to 70 centimeters and prompting evacuations for tens of thousands. Several injuries were reported, with fires breaking out in Aomori. Authorities have formed an emergency task force and are conducting safety checks on nuclear plants, which have shown no issues so far.

title: Smoke billows along LoC areas of Rajouri-Poonch on 2nd day also
content: A massive forest fire erupted along the Line of Control in Rajouri and Poonch districts on Sunday, with dense smoke billowing up. The blaze, likely originating from across the border, is spreading rapidly due to dry conditions and has triggered multiple landmine blasts in forward areas without any reported injuries.

title: 'We gave Sanju opportunities': Samson to get dropped from the playing XI again?
content: Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya return to India's T20I squad for the South Africa series, impacting the middle order. Despite Sanju Samson's good form, captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed Gill will open, with Samson batting in the middle. Jitesh Sharma's recent performance also intensifies competition for middle-order spots.

title: After a $70bn hit, Zuckerberg concedes his biggest bet is 'not working'
content: Meta is reportedly planning significant budget cuts for its Metaverse division, potentially slashing it by 30% as part of its 2026 annual planning. This move follows over $70 billion in losses for the Metaverse vision and a lack of consumer interest in its VR products. The company is now prioritizing its artificial intelligence efforts.

title: Gadkari directs officials to carry out checking of all sleeper buses by govt-approved agencies
content: Following recent bus fires, Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari has ordered government-approved agencies to inspect all sleeper coach buses for safety norm compliance. This directive comes after reports of widespread non-compliance with the new Bus Body Code, leading to calls for action against errant builders and officials.

title: IndiGo crisis: Rs 827 cr refunds, 1,800+ flights operated; recovery explained in key nos
content: India's largest airline, IndiGo, is recovering from a week of unprecedented disruption caused by new pilot duty norms. The crisis led to mass flight cancellations, stranded passengers, and significant financial losses, with over Rs 1,396 crore refunded. The government has imposed fare caps to stabilize prices.

title: Explain Kashmir book ban, HC tells LG admin, Centre
content: The Jammu and Kashmir High Court has granted the administration and the Centre three months to respond to petitions challenging a ban on 25 Kashmir-related books. The ban, imposed by the home department, claims the books promote a "false narrative" and "secessionism." A three-judge bench will hear the petitions, which argue the ban violates free speech guarantees.

title: Want to use your old smartphone as a home security camera: How to set it up
content: Old smartphones can become home security cameras. This guide shows how to use an old phone with a special app. You can monitor your home, children, or pets easily. This is a cost-effective way to enhance home security. Simply install an app on both phones and pair them. Place the camera strategically for best coverage.

title: Chinese national released; cops find immigration violations by hotels, homestays, houseboats
content: A Chinese national was questioned for visa violations after travelling to J&K and Ladakh without permission. Meanwhile, authorities discovered multiple foreign nationals staying in Kashmir without mandatory reporting, leading to FIRs against several hotels and houseboats for non-compliance with Form-C submission norms.

title: Gracie Hunt stuns with runway-ready style in intense mint training session
content: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt showcases her fitness journey, blending athlete-level intensity with stylish presentation in her latest Instagram workout. The 26-year-old influencer demonstrated a full-body circuit, highlighting her strength, discipline, and ability to make workouts visually engaging. Her posts inspire followers by proving fitness can be both fierce and fun, reflecting her mission beyond her family name.

title: The trillion-dollar shock: What tariff? How Xi Jinping beat Trump in trade war
content: Despite nearly a decade of US tariffs, China's trade surplus has surged to a record $1.08 trillion, demonstrating its resilience and dominance in global exports. China has successfully restructured its supply chains, rerouted exports to emerging markets, and leveraged currency advantages to bypass tariff barriers, outmaneuvering US trade war strategies.

title: Bill Gates' daughter gets $30M for AI app: Gates says won't invest; works helpdesk
content: Phoebe Gates' artificial intelligence shopping startup, Phia, has raised $30 million in new funding. This investment values the company at $180 million. Bill Gates, Phoebe's father, has supported the venture with his time and experience. Phia aims to make online shopping smarter and more sustainable. The app offers price comparisons, discounts, and secondhand options.

title: Cross-dressing crook: Burglar dressed as woman arrested in Delhi; 14-day chase busted heist
content: Police apprehended a 24-year-old man in Uttam Nagar after he allegedly broke into a house in Mohan Garden. Disguised as a woman to avoid CCTV detection, he stole jewellery, watches, and a handicam with an associate. The arrest has helped solve ten theft and snatching cases. Recovered items include silver anklets, a handicam, and five mobile phones.

title: 8th pay commission: Govt shares major update in LS; what’s next for employees
content: Over 50 lakh Central government employees and 69 lakh pensioners will be covered under the 8th Pay Commission, with its Terms of Reference notified on November 3, 2025. The commission, headed by Justice Ranjana Prakash Desai, will examine pay, allowances, and pensions. Implementation timelines and funding will be decided later, following the commission's submission of recommendations within 18 months.

title: Kournikova & Iglesias Net Worth 2025: Tennis, music, and business earnings
content: Tennis star Anna Kournikova and music icon Enrique Iglesias boast a combined net worth of $160 million in 2025. While Kournikova's fame transcended her $4 million prize money through lucrative endorsements, Iglesias' wealth stems from over 130 million record sales and global tours. Both have strategically invested in Miami real estate, contributing to their substantial shared fortune.

title: Travis Turner case: Veteran cop shares chilling new theory from the woods
content: A missing Virginia football coach, Travis Turner, may never be found. He vanished from his home on November 20. Authorities charged him with child pornography offenses. A law enforcement expert states dense woods and wildlife make recovery difficult. Search teams are using advanced tools, but success remains uncertain. A reward is offered for information leading to his arrest.

title: NHL match today: Will William Nylander play against Tampa Bay Lightning tonight?
content: William Nylander is set to play for the Toronto Maple Leafs against the Tampa Bay Lightning tonight, a significant boost for the team.  Despite a minor injury, Nylander's return strengthens Toronto's offense, crucial for facing Tampa Bay's formidable defense.  Fans anticipate a dynamic matchup with Nylander expected to be a key player.

title: DGCA notice response: IndiGo blames 5 factors for mess; seeks more time for detailed reply
content: IndiGo has apologized for massive flight disruptions, citing new flight duty rules, winter schedule changes, technical glitches, weather, and system congestion. The airline requested more time from the DGCA for a full analysis, while the aviation minister vowed strict action against IndiGo for its internal crisis.

title: Weakening democracy? MEA's cutting response: 'Pakistan and democracy don't go together'
content: India's MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal stated that "democracy and Pakistan don't go together" while monitoring developments. He also highlighted strong India-US counter-terrorism cooperation, with both nations pushing for tougher UN actions against Pakistan-based terror groups like LeT and JeM.

title: Magnitude 7.6 earthquake strikes Japan; 16-inch tsunami wave recorded
content: A powerful 7.6 magnitude earthquake off Japan's northern coast has triggered a tsunami alert for Hokkaido and surrounding areas.  Country recorded as high as 40-centimetre (16-inch) tsunami. Earlier the Japanese meteorological agency had issued warning of waves up to three meters.

title: Hardik Pandya inches toward history: Indian all-rounder on cusp of major T20I milestone
content: Hardik Pandya is on the verge of a significant T20I milestone, needing 140 runs for 2,000 and just two wickets for 100. Returning from injury, he proved his fitness and is a key player for India's T20 World Cup preparations. The five-match series against South Africa begins December 9.

title: ‘True culprit, my mother’: Twist in Punjab case, 'dead' girl reappears, was thrown into canal
content: A 17-year-old girl, presumed dead for two months after her father allegedly threw her into a canal, has reappeared alive in Ferozepur. She claims her father is innocent, motivated by her mother's instigation, and demands his release while accusing her mother of being the true culprit. Police are investigating the video and will record her official statement.

title: MEA to China: 'Assure Indians won't be targeted'; gives 'no interference' in Arunachal memo
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs has urged Chinese authorities to ensure fair treatment for Indian travelers transiting through their airports. This statement follows reports of alleged harassment of an Arunachal Pradesh woman, prompting an advisory for Indian nationals to exercise caution when traveling to or through China.

title: $108-bn hostile bid: Paramount moves to take over Warner Bros; challenges Netflix’s $72-bn offer
content: Paramount has launched a $108 billion hostile bid for Warner Bros Discovery, directly challenging Netflix's earlier acquisition agreement. This move ignites a major media battle, with Paramount offering shareholders significantly more cash and a faster completion. The outcome could dramatically reshape global entertainment, controlling iconic franchises like HBO and Harry Potter.

title: IPL 2026: What CSK need & who they must target ahead of auctions - Check out
content: Chennai Super Kings enter IPL 2026 at a crossroads, carrying both legacy and last-place disappointment. Major trades, including Jadeja and Curran’s exit and Samson’s arrival, signal a new direction. With gaps in finishing, spin and pace, CSK head into the auction with a big purse and urgent needs as they prepare for life beyond MS Dhoni.

title: Vande Mataram debate: Priyanka's 'chronology' jab at Centre; questions PM's 'selective' history
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the Lok Sabha, accusing him of lacking historical facts in his Vande Mataram debate. She highlighted Rabindranath Tagore's first rendition at a Congress convention and the song's role in the freedom struggle, contrasting it with the PM's narrative of Congress compromises.

title: 'Now or never for Shubman Gill': Former India all-rounder fires warning ahead of T20Is
content: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan urged Shubman Gill to seize his T20 opening opportunity against South Africa, emphasizing the need to solidify his spot for the 2026 World Cup. Pathan also highlighted the crucial search for a reliable finisher to support Hardik Pandya, naming Axar Patel, Jitesh Sharma, and Rinku Singh as potential candidates for the vital role.

title: Charlie McAvoy Injury: Boston Bruins star reveals difficult recovery
content: Boston Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy has opened up for the first time since suffering a severe facial injury that has kept him out of the lineup. The NHL star detailed the extent of the damage, the unexpected challenges he’s facing daily, and why his recovery remains a difficult road. His comments offer clarity for fans following ongoing NHL injury updates.

title: Indian student discloses real preparation needed for studying in the UK
content: Lakshita Bhagtani transitioned from biotechnology to management studies at the University of Exeter, navigating the complexities of international education. She highlights the importance of thorough research, managing unexpected expenses like daily transport, and adapting to a new academic environment. Building a community and balancing studies with part-time work were crucial for her successful transition.

title: Praggnanandhaa becomes first Indian to qualify for Candidates 2026
content: Indian chess prodigy R Praggnanandhaa has earned a coveted spot in the Candidates 2026 tournament by triumphing in the FIDE Circuit 2025. His stellar year, marked by victories in major events, secures his sole male representation for India. Seven participants are confirmed, with one remaining spot to be decided by rating.

title: Justin Trudeau and Katy Perry make it Instagram official: A cheat-sheet to their romance
content: The Japan posts marked the inevitable moment when rumour blurred into reality. Perry did not write an essay or offer an explanation. She simply uploaded a carousel of her trip: serene landscapes, neon streets, sushi dinners and then, suddenly, Justin Trudeau, smiling like a man who had very intentionally chosen this era of his life. The caption, “tokyo times on tour and more”, was vague in the way bold announcements often are. The emoji selection — hearts, flowers, soft smiles — did the rest of the heavy lifting. Trudeau, for his part, had already warmed the public to the idea by sharing a photo of the two with Japan’s former prime minister and his wife. It was the sort of diplomatic cameo that would have looked routine if not for the unmistakable sense that something more was happening beyond the frame.

title: IndiGo crisis: Pilots say chaos was engineered to force rollback of safety norms
content: IndiGo pilots are raising alarms over a series of unusual flight disruptions, claiming they are part of a deliberate strategy to undermine recent safety regulations. They argue that a minor shortage of pilots doesn’t justify the extensive cancellations observed, hinting at intentional changes in operations that could jeopardize the safety of passengers in favor of profit margins.

title: 'Mango, Paneer ...': Not just chess on Russian GM's mind as GCL makes India debut
content: Russian Grandmaster Volodar Murzin, the 2024 FIDE Rapid champion, is set to compete in the Global Chess League in Mumbai. He expressed his fondness for Indian cuisine, particularly mangoes, paneer, and sugarcane juice. Murzin also shared his confidence boost after winning the World Rapid title and his ambition to improve his classical chess game.

title: From Congress to TMC to BJP: Humayun Kabir’s AIMIM alliance pitch rattles Bengal parties
content: Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir expressed readiness to ally with AIMIM for the 2026 Bengal polls, despite his party's strong criticism. Kabir, who recently laid the foundation for a mosque, also claimed CPM, ISF, and Congress were open to alliances, assertions immediately denied by those parties. His political journey has seen multiple party switches.

title: Bullet train '25: India bets big on steel bridges, mega tunnels & high-speed infra
content: India's first bullet train project is rapidly transforming into a reality, with significant progress on tunnels, bridges, and stations.  The Mumbai-Ahmedabad corridor, built with Japanese technology, is set to revolutionize travel, cutting journey times drastically.  Key milestones in 2025, including advanced tunnel breakthroughs and the adoption of next-gen Shinkansen trains, signal India's entry into the global high-speed rail league.

title: 'Very strict action': Aviation minister vows to 'set example' after IndiGo crisis
content: Aviation minister K Rammohan Naidu has vowed "very, very strict action" against IndiGo for its recent flight disruptions, citing internal lapses in crew management and roster planning. He clarified the issue is unrelated to past system malfunctions, emphasizing that the airline's mismanagement caused the crisis.  Naidu stressed that accountability is paramount, promising to set an industry example.

title: IndiGo crisis: Over 500 flights cancelled, Rs 827cr refunds initiated — key points
content: IndiGo's operational crisis continues for a seventh day with over 500 flight cancellations nationwide, stranding thousands of passengers. The Supreme Court declined to intervene, acknowledging government action. The airline attributes the disruptions to crew rostering and internal planning issues following new pilot duty time regulations.

title: After wedding cancelled, Smriti Mandhana's brother shares update on her next move
content: India's vice-captain Smriti Mandhana has resumed cricket training following the cancellation of her wedding to composer Palash Muchhal. She will soon return to competitive cricket in a T20I series against Sri Lanka, which serves as preparation for the T20 World Cup. Mandhana had previously confirmed the wedding's cancellation and emphasised her commitment to cricket.

title: NFL Week 15: Bills road favorites over Patriots, Packers favored at Broncos
content: the Atlanta Falcons host the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in a matchup on "Thursday Night Football" the team have lost four of five to fall to 7-6, now tied with the Carolina Panthers atop the division . the afternoon window offers three outstanding matchups .

title: Chhattisgarh govt amends provisions on land valuation guidelines amid Opposition backlash
content: A good government is one that occasionally amends its decisions in the public interest. Certainly, there are some concerns regarding the guideline rates; they are being reviewed, says Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai

title: Renowned socialist leader Baba Adhav, 95, passes away
content: He had fought against caste system and for the rights of labourers, head-loaders, waste-pickers, and street vendors

title: SC relaxes former T.N. Minister Senthilbalaji’s bail conditions
content: He had a weekly-twice obligation to appear before the Directorate of Enforcement officer investigating a money-laundering case linked to the cash-for-jobs scam

title: Support for BJP rose in Madurai district in 2024 Lok Sabha election, compared with 2016 Assembly election
content: In 2016 Assembly poll, it contested in all seats but Madurai North, securing a single-digit vote share in all others except Madurai  South. In 2024, its vote share exceeded 20% in 5 Assembly segments

title: 13,989 pilots employed by six major domestic airlines: Govt
content: MoS Civil Aviation Murlidhar Mohol said the rationale behind airlines hiring foreign pilots, inter alia, is the requirement of a specific type-rated pilot in light of fleet expansions and time-bound operational requirements.

title: Highways Department takes up repairs on roads damaged during Cyclone Ditwah in Chennai
content: Of the 654 km of roads under the department’s control in the city, potholes have developed on 109 km of the carriageway. Of this, repairs on 89 km has been completed

title: City Union Bank, SalarySe partner up for a credit card exclusively for salaried employees
content: The Level Up Credit Card introduces India's first ‘Salary Day Bonus’ feature, offering up to 37.5% rewards on salary disbursement days, enabling salaried employees to maximize returns on essential expenses coinciding with payroll cycles

title: Goa nightclub fire: Owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra fled to Phuket after tragedy, say police
content: The Bureau of Immigration at Mumbai was contacted, and it was found that both the accused had taken the 6E 1073 flight to Phuket at 5:30 a.m. on December 7, immediately after the fire incident, which occurred around midnight, the officer said

title: Government, Opposition spar in Lok Sabha over Vande Mataram
content: PM Modi charges Nehru with betraying the National Song for Jinnah; Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra questions the need for debate on Vande Mataram that is a part of India’s soul, accuses the government of doing it with eye on Bengal polls

title: Satellite estimates of fire counts overestimate stubble burning reduction
content: “The government should stop using fire counts as a proxy for gauging a decline or increase in stubble burning,” said iForest CEO Chandra Bhushan

title: Kannada and Hindi to enter NLSIU’s curriculum from 2026
content: The move aims to develop a multilingual imagination in students, encouraging them to think, speak, and write across languages, and to engage with the cultural contexts that shape them

title: INDIA bloc plans to move a motion to impeach Madras High Court Judge G.R. Swaminathan
content: The judge last week directed the authorities of the Subramaniya  Swamy Temple at Thirupparankundram to ensure that the  Karthigai Deepam was lit at the deepathoon  (pillar) near a dargah atop the hill

title: IndiGo seeks more time to reply to show-cause notices
content: The airline says it is “not realistically possible to pinpoint the exact causes” of widespread disruptions in flight operations; flight cancellations down to 500 from 1,500 on December 5

title: Trainer aircraft crashes after hitting a power line while landing
content: "Pilot Ajit Chavda and another occupant were injured. They were rescued by power company staff, villagers, and police. The two are undergoing treatment at a private hospital in Barapathar, and both are out of danger," says an official

title: India will overtake China to emerge as second large Construction Equipment player by 2030
content: CII to host 13th edition of EXCON 2025, South Asia’s Construction Equipment Exhibition between December 9 to 13 at the Bangalore International Exhibition Centre

title: Schedule changes, glitches, new rules among causes of disruptions, says IndiGo
content: The airline is "profusely apologetic" and deeply regrets the inconvenience and hardship caused to customers following flight cancellations, Civil Aviation Regulator DGCA said.

title: Centre’s blunder caused Indigo’s flight cancellations ‘disaster’, says Mamata Banerjee
content: The Trinamool Congress chairperson said that she will request the Centre to make some plan so that at least half the flights are operational.

title: HR Conclave to be held at Guru Nanak College on December 10
content: The event is being conducted to expose students to the present-day industry demands and workplace scenarios

title: Man City have history of overtaking Arsenal; will it happen again?
content: pep Guardiola has revealed that their 3-0 win over sunderland was their best performance of the season . the gunners are two points clear of city at the top of the premier league table . aston villa are one point further back in third place following their 2-1 win against arsenal on sunday .

title: The art of drawing flags: Which QBs get the most? Should Justin Herbert argue more?
content: the Chargers beat the Pittsburgh Steelers 25-10 in a week 11 game . the game reflected a season of hits for the team . he has been contacted 149 times and pressured 196 times, both league highs .

title: First round first look: How all eight teams can win
content: the college football playoff selection committee's final top 25 of the season produced a 12-team bracket that includes two regular-season rematches in the first round . no. 9 Alabama at No. 8 Oklahoma and no. 11 Tulane at no. 6 Ole Miss beat Alabama, 23-21, on Nov. 15 . the ACC's best team will have a chance to compete for the national title when no. 10 Miami travels to no. 7 Texas A&M .

title: Women: UConn stays top, Big Ten has nine spots
content: the new AP Top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the top 10 remained the same . Nebraska cornhuskers joined the poll, replacing the west Virginia Mountaineers . a weekend when the no. 1 team lost in college football and men's basketball, the Huskies easily avoided the upset bug .

title: Seahawks put spin on OutKast, Migos album covers to poke fun at Falcons
content: the seahawks outscore the Falcons 31-3 in the second half for a road win . the Seahawks now have three halves this season in which they have outscored opponents by at least 28 points . trolls follow up their post-win graphic with "We're so ATL," then write "Peace Up, A-town down"

title: 'Only two reasons': Priyanka targets govt over Vande Matram debate; brings in 'Bengal election'
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. title: These five players could help decide unpredictable East
content: the Eastern Conference is as unpredictable as any point in recent history . the upstart Detroit Pistons sit atop the standings at the quarter mark . it's too early to predict the contenders that will match up for conference supremacy in spring .

title: A great night for Kent, but another stain on the Hall of Fame
content: the contemporary baseball era committee's Hall of Fame ballot announced Sunday night . if not for Barry Bonds, Jeff Kent might not be bound for Cooperstown . Kent was on the same ballot as Bonds -- who hit more homers than anyone, at any position .

title: 🏈 CFP to Pop-Tarts: Picking every bowl game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: Trump to make Buddha 'smile'? 27 yrs since Pokhran nuclear tests, India at critical point
content: the shadow of India's 1998 Pokhran-II tests still lingers, marked by geopolitical reverberations and economic sanctions . today, with rival states like Pakistan and China accusing rival states of clandestine nuclear tests, India faces a high-stakes dilemma .

title: China's trillion dollar triumph amid Trump's tariff tantrum
content: china announced a $ 1 trillion trade surplus with the world on monday . it is the first time in human history that any country has crossed the milestone . china exported more (approximately $3.6 trillion worth of goods) than it imported (about $ 2.6 trillion)

title: Punjab: Cong suspends Navjot Kaur Sidhu after her 'Rs 500 crore suitcase' charge

title: Opposition slams BJP, says National Song was used to unite people during freedom struggle
content: Trinamool Congress member Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar said Vande Mataram was not only India’s National Song but also a legacy that millions sang to fuel the struggle for Independence.

title: Former Maharashtra CM Chavan warns of aviation monopoly, seeks breakup of IndiGo
content: Congress leader Prithviraj Chavan says IndiGo’s dominance and Tata Group’s growing share threaten competition; urges government to split carrier and revive national airline

title: Naidu urges linguists to coin new words in Telugu language
content: The change in the language is inevitable due to changes in everyday life, culture and traditions, said Nannaya University Vice-Chancellor Prof.S.Prasanna Sree

title: Top CPI (Maoist) leader, 11 others surrender in Chhattisgarh
content: Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai said that in the past two years, over 4,000 Maoists had either surrendered or were killed by the security forces in Chhattisgarh

title: ED is a ‘wrongdoer’ which conducted illegal searches and fabricated T.N. govt. logo, State tells Madras High Court
content: T.N. says the central agency had misrepresented and concealed vital facts in a writ petition seeking a direction to State police to register FIRs on the basis of info shared regarding sand mining offences

title: India ramps up humanitarian efforts in Sri Lanka under Operation Sagar Bandhu
content: Earlier, INS Vikrant, INS Udaygiri and INS Sukanya had extended critical support, including relief supplies and heli-borne search and rescue operations.

title: Two MoUs to pave way for overseas jobs inked by TOMCOM at Global Summit
content: Global Workforce Development, an initiative of Apollo Hospitals, proposes collaboration to empower Telangana’s nursing and healthcare talent and support candidates through specialised skill enhancement, structured language training and globally aligned certification programmes

title: Bias against OBCs must be counted as caste-based discrimination: House panel urges UGC
content: It also asks the government to “re-evaluate” the EWS reservation in Associate Professor and Professor-level appointments.

title: Govt. in touch with experts to find out cause of deaths in Scrub Typhus cases: Health Commissioner
content: There were no deaths reported in people with the disease last year, and therefore the government has decided to take up the research, says Veerapandian

title: Four IAS officers designated as special roll observers in Tamil Nadu
content: They will oversee all activities related to the SIR in the enumeration phase, the claims and objections period and disposal of notices phases, and the final publication of the rolls

title: Kerala actor rape case: Verdict may have huge impact on survivors who want to speak out, says WCC co-founder Bina Paul
content: She says the ruling raises a lot of questions which need to be answered at some point since the survivor actor needs to get closure

title: Watch | Bina Paul: WCC will stick with the survivor, whatever her decisions are
content:
More than eight years after the abduction and sexual assault of a popular actress, a crime which shook the Malayalam film industry and Kerala society, a trial court today has pronounced its verdict on the case. The first six accused were found guilty of the crime, while actor Dileep, the eighth accused and the alleged mastermind who spent close to three months in jail, was found not guilty. Bina Paul, film editor and founder of the Women in Cinema Collective (WCC), which was formed in the aftermath of the incident, speaks to The Hindu on the verdict. 

Interview: S. R. Praveen 
Editing: Thamodharan B

title: Rajnath Singh, Anurag Thakur target Congress during Vande Mataram discussion
content: ‘Most parts of the original version [of the Vande Mataram] have been forgotten, and those stanzas depict the essence of India,’ Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said in the Lok Sabha

title: PMK’s invitation to DMK allies for protest demanding caste survey causes unease
content: Demanding a caste census/survey when the Centre had already announced the schedule for a caste census in 2027 is a farce, says VCK general secretary D. Ravikumar; Congress yet to decide

title: Palnadu road accident: ASI’s son emerges as key suspect
content: According to the police, the accused allegedly halted a container truck on NH-16, which collided with a vehicle, killing five engineering students

title: Dileep demands probe into conspiracy to implicate him in the rape case
content: He says he never had any issues with the survivor in the case. The SIT conspired to implicate me in the case and  misled the government, he adds

title: Post GST rate rationalisation, Karnataka govt. mulls ways to tackle revenue mobilisation challenges
content: The government could be looking at streamlining guarantee scheme beneficiaries, ending old schemes that do not serve meaningful purpose and cutting down on expenditures on human resources as part of belt tightening exercise

title: Anti-government mood fuels UDF strategy in Palakkad
content: Of the seven municipalities, the LDF governs five, while the UDF and BJP govern one apiece. The spotlight is on Palakkad municipality largely because the BJP is in power

title: Delay in permanent campus triggers student protest at Maheshwaram medical college
content: Students said there has been no visible progress or clear timeline for shifting out of the temporary location at the Bharat Institute of Engineering and Technology

title: Woman’s murder case cracked within 24 hours
content: The Ranebennur police have cracked the murder case of a woman within 24 hours with the arrest of the woman’s acquaintance who has confessed to committing the crime

title: Scientists uncover unified mechanism behind immune response
content: The key finding was that a cell’s defense, clean-up systems and self-destruct programs are tightly interconnected, not separate processes

title: Consider recognising Sonam Wangchuk’s institute in Ladakh, House panel tells UGC
content: The committee was impressed with the academic, research, and entrepreneurship ecosystem at the HIAL, especially its success in implementing experiential education and learning rooted in local socio-cultural and ecological contexts

title: ‘Jai Hind’, ‘Inquilab Zindabad’ are equally important, says Su. Venkatesan
content: “Lakhs of people were inspired by these slogans; they faced gallows, guns and cannons. They gathered at Jallianwala Bagh, destroyed ammunition in Chittagong, collected salt in Dandi and ran Swadeshi Shipping Corporation in Thoothukudi. But under which slogan did you (RSS and Sangh Parivar) rally?”

title: KPRS to stage protest outside Gescom demanding uninterrupted power supply to pumpsets
content: The Karnataka Pranta Raitha Sangha will stage a protest in front of Gescom office in Kalaburagi city on Tuesday (December 9), demanding reliable daytime three-phase power for agricultural pumpsets and immediate replacement of burnt transformers and snapped wires across the district
